{"step_by_step_thinking": "The collum angle is the angle between the long axis of the crown and the long axis of the root of a tooth. An increased collum angle is typically seen in Class II div 2 malocclusion, where the upper front teeth are tilted backwards or 'retroclined'. This is because the upper front teeth are pushed back by the lower front teeth, causing an increase in the collum angle.", "answer_choice": "C. Class II div 2"}
